text: The Honorable Frankie Muse Freeman (born Marie Frankie Muse, November 24, 1916 - January 12, 2018) was an American civil rights attorney, and the first woman to be appointed to the United States Commission on Civil Rights (1964 to 1979). On February 5, 2015, President Barack Obama appointed Freeman to serve as a Member of the Commission on Presidential Scholars. Freeman died on January 12, 2018 in Danville, Virginia at the age of 101. ==References== ==Other websites== * The History Maker: Frankie Muse Freeman bio * St. Louis Character: Frankie Freeman, St. Louis Business Journal Category:1916 births Category:2018 deaths Category:African-American lawyers Category:American centenarians Category:American civil rights activists Category:American civil servants Category:Lawyers from Virginia
title: Frankie Muse Freeman
